edu.teco.smartlambda.rest.controller

Class PermissionController

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.teco.smartlambda.rest.controller.PermissionController

  • public class PermissionController
extends Object
    Provides REST calls related to lifecycle handling of permissions.

    • Method Detail

      • readUserPermissions

        public static Object readUserPermissions(spark.Request request,
                                         spark.Response response)
        GET /:user/permissions

        Lists permissions granted to the specified user. No body parameters are required. The response contains an array of all granted permissions grouped by their types.
        Permissions are either granted for a specific lambda or for all lambdas of a user.

        Permission types
        Name Description
        read Read lambda settings
        patch Change lambda settings (includes deploying a new binary or source code container)
        execute Execute lambdas
        delete Delete lambdas
        status Read lambda statistics
        schedule Create scheduled events
        create Create new lambdas
        grant Grant permissions to others
        Can't be granted to keys


        Permission object parameters
        Name Type Description
        user string User a permission is granted to
        lambda string Name of the lambda a permission is granted for, or '*' for permissions granted for all lambdas
        Option invalid for 'create' permissions



        Example

         
         {
              "read":[],
              "execute":[{"user":"foo","name":"*"}],
              "grant":[{"user":"foo","name":"bar"}]
         }
        Throws:
        NotAuthenticatedException - 401 Thrown when user is not properly authenticated
        UserNotFoundException - 404 Thrown when the specified user is unknown

      • grantUserPermissions

        public static Object grantUserPermissions(spark.Request request,
                                          spark.Response response)
                                   throws IOException
        PUT /:user/permissions

        Grants permissions to the specified user. Body must contain a valid list of permissions (see readUserPermissions(spark.Request, spark.Response) for an example). Responds with an empty JSON object on success.

        Throws:
        NotAuthenticatedException - 401 Thrown when user is not properly authenticated
        UserNotFoundException - 404 Thrown when the specified user is unknown
        InsufficientPermissionsException - 403 Thrown when the authenticated user doesn't have sufficient permissions to grant at least one of the specified permissions
        IOException
        See Also:
        readUserPermissions(spark.Request, spark.Response)

      • revokeUserPermissions

        public static Object revokeUserPermissions(spark.Request request,
                                           spark.Response response)
                                    throws IOException
        DELETE /:user/permissions

        Revokes permissions previously granted to the specified user. Body must contain a valid list of permissions (see readUserPermissions(spark.Request, spark.Response) for an example). Responds with an empty JSON object on success.

        Throws:
        NotAuthenticatedException - 401 Thrown when user is not properly authenticated
        UserNotFoundException - 404 Thrown when the specified user is unknown
        InsufficientPermissionsException - 403 Thrown when the authenticated user doesn't have sufficient permissions to revoke (grant) at least one of the specified permissions
        IOException
        See Also:
        readUserPermissions(spark.Request, spark.Response)

      • readKeyPermissions

        public static Object readKeyPermissions(spark.Request request,
                                        spark.Response response)
        GET /key/:name/permissions

        Lists permissions granted to the specified user. No body parameters are required. See readUserPermissions(Request, Response) for a result example.

        Throws:
        NotAuthenticatedException - 401 Thrown when user is not properly authenticated
        UserNotFoundException - 404 Thrown when the specified user is unknown
        See Also:
        readUserPermissions(spark.Request, spark.Response)

      • grantKeyPermissions

        public static Object grantKeyPermissions(spark.Request request,
                                         spark.Response response)
                                  throws IOException
        PUT /key/:name/permissions

        Grants permissions to the specified key. Body must contain a valid list of permissions (see readUserPermissions(spark.Request, spark.Response) for an example). Responds with an empty JSON object on success.

        Throws:
        NotAuthenticatedException - 401 Thrown when user is not properly authenticated
        UserNotFoundException - 404 Thrown when the specified user is unknown
        InsufficientPermissionsException - 403 Thrown when the authenticated user doesn't have sufficient permissions to grant at least one of the specified permissions
        IOException
        See Also:
        readUserPermissions(spark.Request, spark.Response), grantUserPermissions(spark.Request, spark.Response)

      • revokeKeyPermissions

        public static Object revokeKeyPermissions(spark.Request request,
                                          spark.Response response)
                                   throws IOException
        DELETE /key/:name/permissions

        Revokes permissions previously granted to the specified key. Body must contain a valid list of permissions (see readUserPermissions(spark.Request, spark.Response) for an example). Responds with an empty JSON object on success.

        Throws:
        NotAuthenticatedException - 401 Thrown when user is not properly authenticated
        UserNotFoundException - 404 Thrown when the specified user is unknown
        InsufficientPermissionsException - 403 Thrown when the authenticated user doesn't have sufficient permissions to revoke (grant) at least one of the specified permissions
        IOException
        See Also:
        readUserPermissions(spark.Request, spark.Response), revokeUserPermissions(spark.Request, spark.Response)
